title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Nehemiah chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Nehemiah Chapter 10.

questions.question: Who was the Tirshatha that sealed the covenant in Nehemiah 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Nehemiah
questions.explanation: Nehemiah is called the Tirshatha and was one of those who sealed the covenant (Nehemiah 10:1).

questions.question: Which group is listed first among those who sealed the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Priests
questions.explanation: The priests are listed first among those who sealed the covenant (Nehemiah 10:1-8).

questions.question: Who was the son of Azaniah mentioned among the Levites?
questions.correctAnswer: Jeshua
questions.explanation: Jeshua the son of Azaniah is listed among the Levites (Nehemiah 10:9).

questions.question: Which of these was NOT one of the chief of the people who sealed the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Malchijah
questions.explanation: Malchijah was a priest, not a chief of the people (Nehemiah 10:3, 14).

questions.question: True or False: The covenant included a promise not to give their daughters to the people of the land.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: They vowed not to give their daughters to the people of the land nor take their daughters for their sons (Nehemiah 10:30).

questions.question: What was agreed regarding commerce on the Sabbath day?
options: They would buy food only on the Sabbath
They would not buy goods on the Sabbath
They would sell only on the Sabbath
They would work harder on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: They would not buy goods on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: They agreed not to buy ware or victuals on the Sabbath day from the people of the land (Nehemiah 10:31).

questions.question: True or False: The people agreed to leave the seventh year and the exaction of every debt.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The covenant included leaving the seventh year and the exaction of every debt (Nehemiah 10:31).

questions.question: How much was charged yearly for the service of the house of God?
options: A third part of a shekel
questions.correctAnswer: A third part of a shekel
questions.explanation: They charged themselves yearly with a third part of a shekel for the service of the house of God (Nehemiah 10:32).

questions.question: What offerings were included for the continual burnt offering?
questions.correctAnswer: Sabbaths, new moons, set feasts
questions.explanation: The continual burnt offering included sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts (Nehemiah 10:33).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And to bring the firstfruits of our ground, and the firstfruits of all fruit of all trees, year by year, unto the ______ of the LORD.'
questions.correctAnswer: house
questions.explanation: The firstfruits of the ground and fruit were to be brought year by year to the house of the LORD (Nehemiah 10:35).

questions.question: Who was to receive the firstborn of sons and cattle according to the law?
questions.correctAnswer: The priests
questions.explanation: The firstborn of sons and cattle were to be brought to the priests that minister in the house of God (Nehemiah 10:36).

questions.question: True or False: The Levites were to bring up the tithe of the tithes to the house of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The Levites were to bring the tithe of the tithes unto the house of God (Nehemiah 10:38).

questions.question: What role did the priest, son of Aaron, have in relation to the Levites taking tithes?
questions.correctAnswer: He was with the Levites
questions.explanation: The priest, son of Aaron, was with the Levites when they took tithes (Nehemiah 10:38).

questions.question: What types of offerings were to be brought to the chambers where the sanctuary vessels were kept?
questions.correctAnswer: Corn, new wine, and oil
questions.explanation: Offerings of corn, new wine, and oil were to be brought to the chambers of the sanctuary (Nehemiah 10:39).

questions.question: What groups separated themselves to the law of God and sealed the covenant?
options: Priests, Levites, porters, singers, and Nethinims
questions.correctAnswer: Priests, Levites, porters, singers, and Nethinims
questions.explanation: The rest of the people who separated themselves included priests, Levites, porters, singers, and Nethinims (Nehemiah 10:28).

medium.title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Nehemiah Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 10 teach us about faithfulness in commitment to God's law?
options: By entering into a curse and oath to walk in God's law
By ignoring the commandments and statutes
By relying on personal opinions over God's statutes
By neglecting the teachings given by Moses
questions.correctAnswer: By entering into a curse and oath to walk in God's law
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:29 explains that the people vowed with a curse and an oath to walk in God's law and observe all His commandments, judgments, and statutes, demonstrating faithfulness and commitment.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with maintaining integrity in business on the Sabbath. Based on Nehemiah 10, what biblical truth would you share?
options: We should not buy goods on the Sabbath or holy days
We can buy and sell freely without restrictions
We must work harder on the Sabbath to make up for lost time
questions.correctAnswer: We should not buy goods on the Sabbath or holy days
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:31 instructs the people not to buy goods or victuals on the Sabbath day or holy days, emphasizing obedience and honoring God's holy times.

questions.question: How does the passage emphasize the importance of stewardship and generosity?
options: By charging themselves a third of a shekel yearly for the temple service
By neglecting to provide for the temple needs
By depending on others to fund the temple
By refusing to bring offerings to God
questions.correctAnswer: By charging themselves a third of a shekel yearly for the temple service
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:32 describes how they made ordinances to charge themselves annually with a third of a shekel for the service of God's house, demonstrating responsible stewardship and generosity.

questions.question: Based on Nehemiah 10, what can we learn about honoring God in family relationships?
options: Not giving daughters to the people of the land nor taking their daughters for sons
Allowing worldly influences to dictate family choices
questions.correctAnswer: Not giving daughters to the people of the land nor taking their daughters for sons
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:30 teaches the importance of maintaining godly marriages by avoiding intermarriage with the people of the land, which could lead them away from God's ways.

questions.question: What does Nehemiah 10 teach about the role of priests and Levites in the community?
options: They are responsible for receiving tithes and offerings for the temple service
They have no role in managing temple resources
They should live separate from the people
They are only responsible for teaching the law
questions.correctAnswer: They are responsible for receiving tithes and offerings for the temple service
questions.explanation: Verses 37-38 highlight that priests and Levites receive the firstfruits, offerings, and tithes, and the Levites bring a tithe of the tithes to the house of God, showing their stewardship role.

questions.question: A believer wants to know how to persevere in spiritual discipline. What insight does Nehemiah 10 provide?
options: By committing to yearly appointed times for offerings and temple duties
By sporadically attending to spiritual duties
By neglecting the appointed feasts and offerings
By relying solely on personal feelings for worship
questions.correctAnswer: By committing to yearly appointed times for offerings and temple duties
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:34 emphasizes casting lots for wood offerings to be brought year by year at appointed times, teaching perseverance and discipline in worship service.

questions.question: True or False: According to Nehemiah 10, the people pledged to observe the seventh year by releasing debts.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:31 states that they agreed to leave the seventh year and the exaction of every debt, following the biblical principle of debt release.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 10 encourage humility and contentment in giving to God?
options: By dedicating the firstfruits of produce, animals, dough, wine, and oil to God
By giving grudgingly to meet obligations
questions.correctAnswer: By dedicating the firstfruits of produce, animals, dough, wine, and oil to God
questions.explanation: Verses 35-37 describe bringing firstfruits and various offerings, reflecting humility and contentment in honoring God with the best of what they have.

questions.question: What does Nehemiah 10 teach about unity and fellowship within the community?
options: All who separated themselves unto God's law, including priests, Levites, singers, and families, joined together in the covenant
Each group acted independently without unity
Only priests were involved in the covenant
People avoided fellowship to focus on themselves
questions.correctAnswer: All who separated themselves unto God's law, including priests, Levites, singers, and families, joined together in the covenant
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:28 shows a collective commitment of all groups and their families who separated themselves to God's law, highlighting unity in faith and fellowship.

questions.question: True or False: The people in Nehemiah 10 agreed to forsake the house of God and stop bringing offerings.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:39 explicitly states that the people would not forsake the house of God and would continue bringing offerings, showing their dedication and love for God's house.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with giving regularly. According to Nehemiah 10, what principle would encourage consistent generosity?
options: Making ordinances to charge themselves yearly with a specific amount for God's service
Waiting for others to give first
questions.correctAnswer: Making ordinances to charge themselves yearly with a specific amount for God's service
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:32 shows that the people established a yearly charge of a third of a shekel for the temple service, illustrating intentional and consistent giving.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 10 guide believers in dealing with temptation related to intermarriage?
options: By pledging not to give daughters to the peoples of the land nor take their daughters for their sons
By ignoring God's commands on marriage
By focusing only on external appearances
questions.correctAnswer: By pledging not to give daughters to the peoples of the land nor take their daughters for their sons
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:30 specifically addresses the temptation of intermarriage and sets a clear boundary to maintain faithfulness to God's law.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Nehemiah 10 teaches that the Levites should bring up the tithe of the tithes unto the house of our God, to the chambers, into the ______ house.
questions.correctAnswer: treasure
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:38 states that the Levites shall bring the tithe of the tithes unto the house of God, into the treasure house, emphasizing faithful stewardship.

questions.question: What does Nehemiah 10 teach about working with honesty and dedication in serving God?
options: By appointing specific people for temple duties and assigning responsibilities year by year
By doing work only when convenient
questions.correctAnswer: By appointing specific people for temple duties and assigning responsibilities year by year
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:34 describes casting lots among priests, Levites, and people to bring wood offerings at appointed times, showing organized and dedicated service.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 10 emphasize the importance of worship and devotion in daily life?
options: By committing to bring offerings continuously on sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts
By focusing only on personal needs
questions.correctAnswer: By committing to bring offerings continuously on sabbaths, new moons, and set feasts
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:33 teaches continual offerings on sabbaths, new moons, and festivals, showing ongoing devotion and worship as part of daily life.

hard.title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Nehemiah Chapter 10.

questions.question: Who was the leader mentioned first among those who sealed the covenant in Nehemiah 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Nehemiah
questions.explanation: Nehemiah is named first as the Tirshatha and son of Hachaliah among those sealing the covenant (Nehemiah 10:1).

questions.question: Which group is explicitly mentioned as included among those who separated themselves to the law of God?
questions.correctAnswer: Priests, Levites, porters, singers, Nethinims
questions.explanation: Verse 28 lists these groups as those who separated themselves to the law of God along with their families (Nehemiah 10:28).

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 10, what was the community's stance on intermarriage with the people of the land?
options: They would neither give their daughters to nor take daughters from the people of the land
They allowed intermarriage only with priests
Intermarriage was mandatory to integrate society
questions.correctAnswer: They would neither give their daughters to nor take daughters from the people of the land
questions.explanation: The community vowed not to intermarry with the people of the land, reflecting a theme of covenantal purity (Nehemiah 10:30).

questions.question: What economic action regarding the Sabbath day is described in Nehemiah 10?
options: They would not buy any ware or victuals on the Sabbath
They would open markets on the Sabbath
They would pay double prices on the Sabbath
They would trade only with priests on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: They would not buy any ware or victuals on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: The text forbids buying goods on the Sabbath or holy days to honor the day of rest (Nehemiah 10:31).

questions.question: What annual financial contribution was established for the service of the house of God?
options: A third part of a shekel
questions.correctAnswer: A third part of a shekel
questions.explanation: They agreed to charge themselves yearly with a third part of a shekel for temple service (Nehemiah 10:32).

questions.question: What offerings are specifically mentioned as being included in the temple service in Nehemiah 10?
options: Showbread, continual meat offering, continual burnt offering, Sabbaths, new moons, set feasts, holy things, sin offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Showbread, continual meat offering, continual burnt offering, Sabbaths, new moons, set feasts, holy things, sin offerings
questions.explanation: Verse 33 details various offerings to maintain atonement and temple worship in accordance with the law.

questions.question: How was the responsibility for bringing wood for the altar decided among the priests, Levites, and people?
questions.correctAnswer: By casting lots
questions.explanation: They cast lots year by year to determine who would bring the wood offering to the temple (Nehemiah 10:34).

questions.question: What firstfruits were to be brought annually to the house of the LORD according to Nehemiah 10?
options: The firstfruits of the ground and all fruit of trees
questions.correctAnswer: The firstfruits of the ground and all fruit of trees
questions.explanation: Verse 35 commands bringing the firstfruits of the ground and all fruit of trees year by year to the LORD's house.

questions.question: What is the significance of bringing the firstborn of sons and cattle according to the law as mentioned in Nehemiah 10?
options: It is an acknowledgment of God's ownership and provision
It was a tax to the king
It was a way to avoid military service
It was a voluntary gift without legal basis
questions.correctAnswer: It is an acknowledgment of God's ownership and provision
questions.explanation: The firstborn were dedicated to God, reflecting the covenantal law emphasizing God's sovereignty (Nehemiah 10:36).

questions.question: What role does the priest, son of Aaron, have in relation to the Levites and tithes according to Nehemiah 10?
options: He shall be with the Levites when they take tithes and help bring the tithe of the tithes to the house of God
He collects all the tithes for himself
He has no role in tithes
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be with the Levites when they take tithes and help bring the tithe of the tithes to the house of God
questions.explanation: Verse 38 describes the priest's role as assisting the Levites in the handling and bringing of tithes to the treasury.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 10, who are responsible for bringing offerings of corn, new wine, and oil to the sanctuary chambers?
options: Children of Israel and children of Levi
questions.correctAnswer: Children of Israel and children of Levi
questions.explanation: Both Israelites and Levites bring offerings to the chambers where the sanctuary vessels and ministers are (Nehemiah 10:39).

questions.question: True or False: The people vowed to observe the commandments, judgments, and statutes given by Moses as the servant of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: They entered into an oath to walk in God's law given by Moses and to observe all commandments (Nehemiah 10:29).

questions.question: Which of the following names is NOT listed among the priests who sealed the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Hananiah
questions.explanation: Hananiah is mentioned later in the list of leaders but not specifically among the priests who sealed the covenant in verses 1-8 (Nehemiah 10:1-8).

questions.question: The structure of the list of signatories in Nehemiah 10 demonstrates what literary technique common in Hebrew texts?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: The listing of priests, Levites, and chiefs in parallel groups shows parallelism, a common Hebrew literary device emphasizing order and completeness (Nehemiah 10:1-27).

questions.question: How does the covenant in Nehemiah 10 reflect the legal traditions found in the Pentateuch?
options: By reaffirming laws given by Moses such as Sabbath observance, tithes, and purity
By rejecting the laws of Moses
By focusing only on civil laws
questions.correctAnswer: By reaffirming laws given by Moses such as Sabbath observance, tithes, and purity
questions.explanation: The covenant echoes Mosaic law themes like Sabbath rest, tithes, firstfruits, and separation from foreign peoples (Nehemiah 10:29-39), connecting to Torah statutes.

theological.title: Nehemiah Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Nehemiah Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who was the leader among those that sealed the covenant in Nehemiah 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Nehemiah
questions.explanation: Nehemiah is explicitly named as the Tirshatha and leader who sealed the covenant (Nehemiah 10:1). This highlights God’s providential leadership, consistent with leaders like Moses (Exodus 24:3-8) and Joshua (Joshua 24:1-28) who led covenant renewals.

questions.question: Which group was responsible for bringing the tithes to the house of God according to Nehemiah 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Levites
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:37 states that the tithes of the ground were brought to the Levites, who ministered in the cities of their tillage. This reflects the Old Testament role of Levites as caretakers of temple worship (Numbers 18:21-24; Malachi 3:10; Hebrews 7:5).

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 10, what was forbidden regarding marriage?
options: Giving daughters to the people of the land
Marrying within the tribe of Levi
questions.correctAnswer: Giving daughters to the people of the land
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:30 forbids giving their daughters to the people of the land or taking their daughters for their sons. This covenantal separation points to holiness and avoiding idolatrous influences (Deuteronomy 7:3-4; Ezra 9:12; 2 Corinthians 6:14).

questions.question: What was the purpose of the yearly charge of a third part of a shekel?
options: Service of the house of God
questions.correctAnswer: Service of the house of God
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:32 states this levy was for the service of the house of God, including offerings and temple upkeep. This parallels the Old Testament temple tax (Exodus 30:13-16; 2 Chronicles 31:4-5; Matthew 17:24-27).

questions.question: What did they vow concerning the Sabbath day in Nehemiah 10?
options: Not to buy or sell on the Sabbath
To work twice as much on the Sabbath
To offer sacrifices on the Sabbath only
To rest only if the king commanded
questions.correctAnswer: Not to buy or sell on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:31 reveals their commitment not to engage in commerce on the Sabbath, honoring God’s holy day as commanded (Exodus 20:8-11; Leviticus 23:3; Isaiah 56:2-7; Hebrews 4:9-10).

questions.question: Who were included among those who took the covenant in Nehemiah 10:28?
options: Priests, Levites, porters, singers, Nethinims, and those separated to God's law
Only the nobles of the people
questions.correctAnswer: Priests, Levites, porters, singers, Nethinims, and those separated to God's law
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:28 lists all these groups along with their families, showing a comprehensive community commitment to God's law, paralleling Israel's corporate responsibility (Ezra 10:1-4; Deuteronomy 29:10-15; Romans 12:4-5).

questions.question: What did the people promise concerning debts every seventh year?
options: To leave the exaction of every debt
questions.correctAnswer: To leave the exaction of every debt
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:31 includes the promise to observe the Sabbatical year by releasing debts, consistent with the Mosaic law for social justice (Deuteronomy 15:1-2; Leviticus 25:3-7; Matthew 18:21-35).

questions.question: What offering was assigned by casting lots among priests, Levites, and the people?
questions.correctAnswer: Wood offering for the altar
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:34 describes casting lots to assign the wood offering responsibilities, emphasizing orderly worship service (Exodus 30:7; 1 Chronicles 9:22; 2 Chronicles 31:11).

questions.question: What firstfruits were the people to bring to the house of the LORD yearly?
options: Firstfruits of the ground, fruit of trees, dough, wine, and oil
questions.correctAnswer: Firstfruits of the ground, fruit of trees, dough, wine, and oil
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:35-37 clearly mentions bringing firstfruits of all produce and offerings, reflecting Israel’s gratitude and recognition of God’s provision (Exodus 23:19; Proverbs 3:9; Romans 11:16; James 1:17).

questions.question: What was the role of the priest, son of Aaron, in relation to the Levites and tithes?
options: To be with the Levites when they take tithes and receive the tithe of tithes
To distribute tithes to the people
To collect taxes for the king
To lead the singing during offerings
questions.correctAnswer: To be with the Levites when they take tithes and receive the tithe of tithes
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:38 states the Aaronic priest accompanies the Levites during the collection of tithes and receives a portion, highlighting priestly duties (Numbers 18:26-28; Malachi 3:8-10; Hebrews 7:1-10).

questions.question: What types of offerings were the children of Israel and Levi to bring to the sanctuary chambers?
options: Offering of corn, new wine, and oil
questions.correctAnswer: Offering of corn, new wine, and oil
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:39 specifies offerings of corn, new wine, and oil brought to the sanctuary vessels, priests, porters, and singers, reflecting the holistic worship system (Leviticus 2:1-16; Numbers 18:12-13; Philippians 4:18).

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 10, what spiritual attitude did the people demonstrate by entering the covenant with a curse and an oath?
options: Serious commitment to obey God's law
questions.correctAnswer: Serious commitment to obey God's law
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:29 reveals the people took a solemn oath and curse to faithfully observe God's law, emphasizing covenant faithfulness and fear of God (Deuteronomy 29:12-15; Joshua 24:14-25; Hebrews 6:13-18).

questions.question: Which of the following groups is NOT specifically mentioned as part of the covenant community in Nehemiah 10:28?
questions.correctAnswer: Scribes
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:28 lists priests, Levites, porters, singers, and Nethinims, but does not mention scribes, distinguishing specific temple service roles (Ezra 2:41-43; Nehemiah 7:46-60).

questions.question: What was the significance of bringing the firstborn of sons and cattle to the house of God, as stated in Nehemiah 10?
options: It acknowledged God's ownership and provision
It was a form of tax to the king
It was a tradition without covenant meaning
questions.correctAnswer: It acknowledged God's ownership and provision
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:36 teaches bringing the firstborn to God acknowledges His sovereignty and grace, consistent with Exodus 13:12-15 and Luke 2:22-24, pointing to Christ as the firstborn consecrated to God (Colossians 1:15).

questions.question: What was the community’s stance on commerce with the people of the land on the Sabbath and holy days?
options: They would not buy from them on those days
They would freely buy and sell
They would only sell but not buy
They would ignore the Sabbath rules
questions.correctAnswer: They would not buy from them on those days
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 10:31 states they committed not to buy from the people of the land on Sabbath and holy days to honor God’s sanctity of time (Exodus 20:8-11; Nehemiah 13:15-22; Luke 13:10-17).
